Article.name: Spicy Duck with Ravioli and Broccoli
Article.title: Spicy Duck with Ravioli and Broccoli

p.span: This is a wonderful and tasty dish. I first tasted it during one cool fall evening in southern France. Whenever I cook it, the memories of the beautiful mountainside and the very special scent of the landscape come to my mind. By the way, the dish is perfect for a dinner party (if you prepare the oven a little in advance).

div.p:
1 teaspoons salt
1/2 teaspoon black pepper
1/2 teaspoon ginger
1 tablespoon olive oil

10 ounces mushroom ravioli
7 ounces smoked bacon, chopped
1 large sweet onion, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons butter
1 large bunch broccoli, coarsely chopped
Boil the red wine in a heavy saucepan until it is reduced to about 1/3 of a cup.
Cut each duck in half (lengthwise) and cut away the backbone. Cut off leg and breast pieces. Put all pieces on a platter.

Preheat oven to 200°C. Mix salt, black pepper, and ginger in a small bowl. Rub mixture all over duck pieces. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add leg pieces, cook until medium brown. Cover pan and roast duck for 40 minutes. Transfer the duck to a plate and cover it with foil to keep it warm.
Use the same pan and add duck breasts. Cook for about 10 minutes per side.

Cook the ravioli in a large pot of boiling water (slightly salted) until tender. Stirr occasionally. Cook the bacon in a large pan until crisp. Place the bacon on a paper towel. Leave 2 tablespoons drippings in the pan and add the onions. Heat until they are tender and golden brown. Add the butter und the broccoli until the broccoli becomes tender. Then, add ravioli and stir until heated throughly. Stir in the bacon and season with salt and pepper.
Make 4 servings out of the ravioli mixture, and add the duck pieces atop. Drizzle with the red wine syrup.
